newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: INDICATORS - CZECH REPUBLIC - UPDATED JAN 16.
newsitem.headline: INDICATORS - CZECH REPUBLIC - UPDATED JAN 16.

text.p: CZECH GDP (in pct) Q3 96 Q2 96 Q1-Q3 96 H1 96
CZECH GDP (in CZK bln) Q3 96 Q1-Q3 96
Note. All figures are subject to revision. All results
measure percentage change for period, year-on-year, except
where listed as being in crowns. All percentage changes, and
total amount listed in real, inflation adjusted terms.
The CSU changed the methodology for calculating the
inflation adjusted real amount in billions of crowns at the
beginning of the year. All figures use 1994 as a base.
The CSU has not released the real percentage changes for
1995 re-calculated using the new methodology. Nominal 1995
figures using the new methodology -- 1989 was the previous base
REVISED 1995 CZECH GDP Q1 Q2 Q3 Q4 1995
Note. Above inflation adjuseted figures use new methodology
with 1994 prices as the base. Deflator used for 1995 real GDP
results was 10.1 percent, compared with 7.9 percent for the
first quarter and 9.1 percent for the second quarter 1996.
Czech 1995 GDP, using the old methodolgy grew 4.8 percent,
with growth of 3.9 percent in the first quarter, 4.0 percent in
the second quarter. The CSU did not release a figure under the
old methodology for the third quarter of 1996.
Note. Results are preliminary and subject to revision.
Resutlts for Q1-Q3 1996 use an exchange rate of 27.162
CZECH STATE BUDGET CY 1996* Jan-Nov 96 CY 1995
CZECH FOREIGN RESERVES Nov 1996 Oct 1996 Nov 1995
Note. Measures through end of period. All 1996 figures
CZECH CONSUMER INFLATION Dec 96 Nov 96 Dec 95
CZECH PRODUCER PRICES DEC 1996 NOV 1996 DEC 1995
pct change month/month n/a n/a n/a
CZECH FOREIGN TRADE JAN-NOV 96 JAN-OCT 96 JAN-NOV 95
Note. All figures in billions of crowns on customs-cleared
basis and subject to revision. Previously reported figures in
CZECH M2 MONEY OCT 1996 SEPT 1996 OCT 1995
Note. All 1996 figures subject to revision, figures
reported previously by the CNB are in brackets.
Czech M2 measures currency, demand deposits, time and
savings deposits, and foreign currency deposits.
The bottom figures exlude the effect of SPT Telecom's $1.32
billion equity expansion in the summer of 1995 which was put on
deposit at the Czech National Bank (CNB).
INDUSTRIAL OUTPUT NOV/96 OCT/96 JAN-NOV-96 NOV/95
NOTE. Preliminary estimates in brackets. The average
nominal industrial wage in November was 11,682 crowns compared
with 10,202 in October. The November index of real wages was up
5.3 percent, while the real wage index was 7.6 percent higher
for the first 11 months of the year.
Wage results sample companies with 100 or more employees
while output results include estimates of smaller firms as
CONSTRUCTION OUTPUT NOV/96 OCT/96 NOV/95 JAN-NOV/96
Note: Output figures are based on all sizes of companies.
Wage figures are calculated only on the basis of companies with
CZECH REAL RETAIL SALES NOV 96 OCT 96 JAN-NOV 96
Note: All figures are preliminary. Total internal trade
includes retail sales plus sales and repairs of motor cars,
motor fuel, restaurant services and accommodation.
It said withdrawls from the SPT accounts and payments on
debt servicing were reflected in the results.
